comments.content:
Probably some kind of Garamond. [Parachute Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170304/http:/www.parachute.gr/typefaces) has released once upon a time (1993) a font named PF Garamond Classic which is very close to your sample. See the image bellow (even that /g is similar):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317170304im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PFGaramondClassic_4584.jpg)
That seems to be it. Thanks.
